posts.title: Talking Books: Asian American Authors in Conversation, 2021-22 Preview
posts.text: A new lineup of Asian American authors will visit with us to talk about their latest books beginning this September.

posts.title: Asian American Authors in Conversation: The Books On My Nightstand
posts.text: We asked authors who took part in Chatham Square Library's book talk series what books they're reading now, what books they intend to read, or books that they love and recommend to others.

posts.title: Asian American Authors in Conversation: The Books That First Made Me Feel Represented
posts.text: As part of our monthly conversation series discussing their work, authors shared with us the first books that reflected themselves and their community.

posts.title: Asian Pacific American Heritage Month Recommendation: 'Asian Americans' Documentary on PBS
posts.text: The film is an excellent overview of a rich history that has often been overlooked in mainstream American consciousness.

posts.title: Book Display Honoring APA Heritage Month at Chatham Square Library
posts.text: See featured books for adults, young adults, and kids, all celebrating Asian Pacific American Heritage Month. On display at the Chatham Square Library through June 7.
